course_title: Clinical Skills in Psychotherapy 3: Psychodynamic and Psychoanalytic Therapy

learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate advanced capacity to provide mental health services at industry appropriate levels in collaboration with others
Demonstrate application of psychoanalytic therapy informed approaches to assessment, formulation and treatment planning and, where appropriate, initiate a treatment plan
Demonstrate use of reflective capacity to inform psychotherapeutic interventions in a supervised working environment
Demonstrate critical reasoning to examine psychoanalytic therapy approaches to assessment, treatment planning and psychotherapy

assessments.task_description:
You should post 2 entries in the online discussion board (one for each week) in which you present and briefly discuss two key concepts from that week's readings, to then reflect on the potential application of such concepts for your current clinical practice. The posts should be clearly written, demonstrate understanding of the concepts and reflective thinking, and not exceed the 500 words limit.

Please consult with staff for legitimate use of AI for this activity. The course coordinator or tutor might organise an oral examination of the online discussion board to confirm authorship of the posts and verify learnings acquired through its elaboration. Please check https://guides.library.uq.edu.au/tools-and-techniques/ai-student-hub/ai-for-assessment

Criteria & Marking:

1. You have posted 2 entries in the online discussion journal that have been posted during the corresponding week. Each entry should be within the 500 words margin (+/- 10% tolerance)

2. The entries are clearly written and well referenced.

3. Each post clearly and briefly present 2 concepts from the readings, demonstrating understanding of these concepts by applying them reflectively to current clinical challenges you choose to discuss.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Post on Discussion Board at the course Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Please refer to the UQ policy on late submission.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
14/05/2026 - 28/05/2026

Specific date of presentation to be determined with course coordinator.

Presentations will be video recorded as per UQ policy on oral presentations.
assessments.task_description:
In this oral presentation you will present to the tutorial group a clinical vignette from your own practice in which you demonstrate the application of a psychoanalytic skill of the course (e.g. transference interpretation, etc.) to a case. After presenting this clinical vignette with the application of the skill and its outcome, you will lead a brief group discussion to consider the pros and cons of this intervention, proposing an alternative course of action you might have followed for the same clinical situation.

Use of PowerPoint slides to support your presentation is recommended.

You will have 15 minutes for the presentation. A suggested time distribution is 5 minutes to describe the case and the application of the skill, and 10 minutes to lead group discussion about its pros and cons and discuss alternative intervention.

Criteria & Marking:

  1. Student presents a clinical example in which a psychoanalytic intervention or the application of a psychoanalytic concept is clearly demonstrated.
  2. Students lead a discussion in which a critique of intervention is presented, including the pros and cons of such intervention, and an alternative intervention to the one presented.
  3. During this discussion, the student applies pertinent psychoanalytic concepts and demonstrates its understanding.
  4. The student stays within the 15 minutes limit, presentation is well organised and clear, and shows good use of visual aids such as PowerPoint slides.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Please refer to the UQ policy on late submission.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Through the Safran video series you had the opportunity to observe an experienced psychoanalytic therapist at work. Identify a segment of a session or of the therapeutic process that illustrates a key intervention or core feature of the therapist's approach (such as the interpretation of transference, for example). Propose an internal debate within the therapist about why he intervened the way he did. Explain in what ways this intervention might have been both useful and detrimental for the patient. Propose an alternative psychoanalytic intervention that could have been utilised by the therapist to address the same situation. Identify how this technical debate might influence your clinical practice.

You should be able to demonstrate sound application of psychoanalytic concepts in the development of this essay and include proper referencing.

Please consult with staff for legitimate use of AI for this essay. The course coordinator or tutor might organise an oral examination of the essay to confirm authorship of the essay and verify learnings acquired through its elaboration. Please check https://guides.library.uq.edu.au/tools-and-techniques/ai-student-hub/ai-for-assessment

Criteria & Marking:

1. Identify a key segment of a session or in the therapeutic process (through several sessions) containing one of, or a combination of interventions that reject a core feature of the therapist's approach. 

2. Propose an internal debate within the therapist about why she/he would intervene at this time and in this manner, applying pertinent psychoanalytic concepts to develop this analysis and discussion, including appropriate referencing. 

3. Articulate alternative psychoanalytic therapy interventions that could have been utilised by the therapist in that situation. 

4. Identify any ways in which the chosen segment has influenced the students own clinical practice. 

5. The quality of writing corresponds to post-graduate level, including proper referencing and citation according to standard format. Word count (excluding references) is within +/- 10% of the specified limit.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission is via Turnitin in the link provided in the Learn.UQ (Blackboard) site
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
T2: The initial phase, engagement and assessment

This tutorial discusses the goal and the how to proceed with the initial assessment and engagement phase of therapy that ends with a formulation and treatment indication.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04

This tutorial addresses how to conduct the therapeutic process, with emphasis on management of transference - countertransference dynamics.
